summary:
**Point of Contact**

* Confidential information for further questions on the case

**Annex II: Monitoring Team Responsibilities**

* Collate, assess, monitor and report on implementation of measures
* Submit a comprehensive program of work to the Committee
* Submit two comprehensive, independent reports to the Committee
* Analyze reports submitted by Member States
* Work closely with CTED and the 1540 Committee's group of experts
* Assist the Committee with analysis of non-compliance
* Present recommendations to the Committee
* Consult with Member States in advance of travel
* Encourage Member States to submit names and additional identifying information for inclusion on the Consolidated List
* Study and report on the changing nature of the threat of Al-Qaida and the Taliban.
The Monitoring Team shall: 
k. Consult with Member States and other relevant organizations, including regular dialogue with representatives, taking into account their comments, especially on issues in the Monitoring Team’s reports; 
l. Consult with Member States’ intelligence and security services to facilitate information sharing and strengthen enforcement; 
m. Consult with private sector representatives, including financial institutions, to learn about the assets freeze implementation and develop recommendations; 
n. Work with international and regional organizations to promote awareness of and compliance with the measures; 
o. Assist other Security Council subsidiary bodies and expert panels, upon request, with enhancing their cooperation with Interpol; 
p. Report to the Committee regularly or upon request, through oral and/or written briefings; 
q. Undertake any other responsibility identified by the Committee.
